trans-unit.source: Contains a read-only collection of <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects for each <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> in a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.

A user cannot add or remove a <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> from the collection, but can change the properties of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> corresponding to a particular <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
Adding or removing a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> from the DataSet adds or removes the corresponding <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> from the collection.
Copies the collection objects to a one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> instance starting at the specified index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the values copied from the collection.
The index of the array at which to start inserting.
Copies the collection objects to a one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> instance starting at the specified index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the values copied from the collection.
The index of the array at which to start inserting.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection"></xref>.
The number of <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> objects is the same as the number of <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects in the <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.
The number of <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects in the collection.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Returns `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).
This property implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Derived classes can provide a synchronized version of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection> using the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property.
This property is always `false`, unless overridden by a derived class.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects of the specified <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to find.
A collection of <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> specified by its index.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to find.
A collection of <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> specified by its name.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> to find.
A collection of <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSetting"></xref> objects.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection"></xref>.
Derived classes can provide a synchronized version of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection> using the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property.

Program code must always perform synchronized operations on the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection.SyncRoot%2A> of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection>, not directly on the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection>.
This guarantees the correct operation of collections that are derived from other objects.
Specifically, it maintains the correct synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection"></xref>.
